results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 3.
results.creator_credit: Stockley Chase Productions, Pam Stockley, John Chase and David Pritchard
results.brief_description: Keith Floyd concludes his culinary journey around Australia with visits to the Northern Territory and Queensland. Highlights include his attempt to interest some truckies in a gourmet lunch of chicken, a meal cooked in a pit on a Queensland beach and mud crabs cooked by a rain forest river in the company of an Aboriginal dance troupe.

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, John Chase, Pam Stockley and David Pritchard
results.brief_description: Floyd travels through locations in Australia, meeting people, seeing different sights and cooking dishes in exotic surroundings. In Central Australia he dines on a silver service table on the Adelaide River. In West Australia he creates a piquant sauce for the wife of Australian millionaire, Alan Bond. In the outback Floyd cooks for the Bishop of The Kimberleys. He eats aboriginal food on a bush tucker tour.

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Pam Stockley, John Chase and David Pritchard
results.brief_description: In Sydney Floyd cooks a fish chowder for Sydney seafood supremo, Peter Doyle and finishes with pies and peas at the famous Harry’s Cafe de Wheels. In Tasmania Floyd creates seasonal autumn dishes. In Victoria Floyd becomes the cook for legendary horseman Jack Lovick. And in South Australia Floyd tastes some “Aussie” food: yabbies, razorfish and kangaroo-tail soup.

results.title: Floyd on France
results.brief_description: Floyd is here with the best in French cuisine. Join the shy and retiring!! cook extraordinaire Keith Floyd in the BBC batmobile as he winds his way through six of the great gastronomic and panoramic regions of France and a few of its lesser known mouthwatering kitchens. The classic flavours of French country cooking - the slow simmering stews, the succulent roasts, the creamy sauces, are lovingly celebrated in this video. Rated: G

results.title: Floyd Hyde
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
A portrait of the dynamic 45 year old artist-attorney, who is the popular and progressive Mayor of the city of Fresno, California. This is a large city with a population of 160,00 whose economy is dependent on the income generated by the fertile surrounding rural areas. Narrated by Barry Sullivan.

results.title: Flowers on a one way street
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: Yorkville Avenue, Toronto, received newspaper prominence after it became what the papers called a “hippie haven”. This film records what happened after the young people staged demonstrations to have the street closed to traffic, and civic authorities used corresponding persuasions to keep it open as a necessary traffic artery. The main confrontation takes place at a council meeting in City Hall, to which spokesmen for the young people have come to present their case. Here the film provides opportunity to judge both their attitudes and those of the city administration. Music by The Beatles and Ravi Shankar. Photography by Douglas Kiefer and edited Christopher Cordeaux. (Awards: Chicago; New York).

results.title: Flowers of Rethymnon
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Warriors”.
A drama-documentary based on the memoirs of Lewis Lind. Lew Lind was a member of the Australian 2/11 Battalion, 3 Company, who defended Rethymnon in Crete against the German invasion in 1941. Following the German occupation of Crete, Lind was imprisoned in a POW camp from which he escaped with three other soldiers. This film uses interviews with Lind during his return to Crete in the 80s and re-enactments of the wartime experiences of Lind and fellow soldier, Dick Plant, who were sheltered by the Cretans from the Nazis. A notable feature of the program is the archival German newsreel footage on the invasion of Crete.

results.title: Flowers in daily life
results.brief_description: Introduces the traditional Japanese art of flower arrangement including its historical and spiritual aspects. Shows the viewer a step-by-step guide to the daily art of flower arrangement.

results.title: Flowers by request
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jules Taylor and Susan Wallace
results.brief_description: Two women who live quiet, eccentric lives have to come to terms with the possibility of separation when one of them has a stroke. At the point when Martha’s only option is being placed in aged care, Nancy steps in to bolster her friend’s spirits. This is a sensitive portrayal of two older women’s friendship and their struggle to retain this special relationship amid a daughter’s intention to place Martha in care. Cast includes Melissa Jaffer, Betty Lucas and Judy Morris.
